SENT.plain: We report a middle-aged woman presenting with acute confusion and anterograde amnesia
Magnetic resonance imaging revealed an acute infarction of the anterior genu fornices
Evaluation of an elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate led to the diagnosis of giant cell arteritis (GCA)
Cerebral infarction is a known complication of GCA; this is the first report of such an association with selective fornix infarction
